intro: Dimorphanthera breviflos, commonly known as the short-flowered dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces small, bright-colored blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires moderate sunlight to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
